info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 22 at 11:56AM CDT until August 22 at 3:00PM CDT by NWS Houston/Galveston TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following county, Harris.
* WHEN...Until 300 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1156 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fourth Ward, Downtown Houston, Midtown Houston, Near Northside Houston, Neartown / Montrose, Greater Heights, Memorial Park, Greater Fifth Ward, Greater Third Ward, Second Ward, Greater Eastwood, University Place, Macgregor, Afton Oaks / River Oaks Area, Greenway / Upper Kirby Area, southern Northside / Northline, Museum Park, Independence Heights, Kashmere Gardens and Lazybrook / Timbergrove. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON
